    <p><strong>‘Do-Does‘</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> untuk menjelaskan aktivitas di masa kini (</span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">present</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;">) dapat berfungsi sebagai </span><strong>kata bantu (</strong><strong><em>Auxiliary Verb</em></strong><strong>)</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> dalam kalimat negatif/</span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">negative</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;"> (-) dan pertanyaan</span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">/interrogative</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;"> (?) bergantung pada </span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">subject</span></em><span style="font-weight: 400;"> yang digunakan.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Berikut perbedaan penggunaannya:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="background-color: #00ffff;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">‘</span><strong>Do</strong><strong><em>’ </em></strong></span><span style="font-weight: 400;">digunakan dengan subject </span><span style="background-color: #00ff00;"><strong>I/You/They/We</strong></span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> atau jumlah yang lebih dari satu.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="background-color: #00ffff;"><strong>‘Does</strong><strong><em>’ </em></strong></span><span style="font-weight: 400;">digunakan dengan subject </span><span style="background-color: #00ff00;"><strong>He/She/It</strong></span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> atau jumlah yang hanya satu.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Setelah </span><strong><em>Do/Does</em></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> akan diikuti oleh penggunaan </span><strong>Verb 1</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></li>
</ul>
<p><strong><em>Contoh:</em></strong></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">There are </span><strong>some people </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">who</span><strong> do not </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">have chairs to sit. </span></li>

<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Does </span><strong>her mother </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">work in the hospital?</span></li>
</ul>

<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Ditambahkan </span><span style="background-color: #00ffff;"><strong>“the most …”</strong></span><span style="font-weight: 400;">, jika terdiri dari lebih dari 2 suku kata sifat </span><strong><em>(long adjective)</em></strong><strong><em><br /></em></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">Contoh kata: </span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">expensive, handsome</span></em></li>

<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Usually (biasanya) = 75%</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sometimes (kadang-kadang) = 50%</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Rarely (Jarang) = 25%</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Never (Tidak pernah) = 0%</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Penulisan </span><strong><em>AOF </em></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">di sebuah kalimat wajib diletakkan </span><strong>setelah subjek</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">, </span><span style="color: #ff0000;"><strong><em>kecuali </em></strong></span><span style="font-weight: 400;">untuk </span><strong><em>sometimes</em></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">, dimana dapat diletakkan dimana saja.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Contoh:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">I feel sleepy if I don't drink the coffee. I </span><strong>always </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">drink a cup of coffee every morning.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">From </span><strong>Monday to Friday</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> I play piano = I </span><strong>usually </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">play piano.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Jenny & Lisa </span><strong>usually </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">go shopping together every </span><strong>Tuesday to Saturday</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">I </span><strong>sometimes </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">add sugar to my tea.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Dodo likes Pizza. He buys pizza </span><strong>once a month</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> because it is expensive. He </span><strong>rarely </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">eats pizza.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">I </span><strong>never </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">cheat in the exam.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">It is her</span><strong> first time</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> eating sushi. Jenny has </span><strong>never </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">eaten sushi </span><strong>before</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></li>
</ul>
